text: Francis Shelley "Frank" White (March 13, 1847August 1, 1922) was a U.S. senator from the state of Alabama. Born in Noxubee County, Mississippi, he became a lawyer and served in the Civil War. He was elected to the Mississippi House of Representatives and then moved to Birmingham, Alabama to practice law. He was elected to fill the term left by the death of Joseph F. Johnston and served from May 11, 1914 to March 4, 1915. He did not run for reelection. His interment was located in Birmingham's Elmwood Cemetery. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1847 births Category:1922 deaths Category:People from Noxubee County, Mississippi Category:People of Mississippi in the American Civil War Category:Members of the Mississippi House of Representatives Category:United States senators from Alabama Category:Alabama Democrats Category:Democratic Party United States senators Category:People from Monroe County, Mississippi
title: Francis S. White
